State Civil Service administers six written tests on a continual basis. These tests are not associated with actual vacancies, but are available to provide the opportunity to test and obtain a score in advance of a vacancy being posted. Once a tester obtains a score, it is automatically available to state agencies.

Use the Coastal Protection & Restoration Authority's website to get geospatial, tabular database, and document access to the suite of protection/restoration projects, Coastwide Reference Monitoring System stations, the current Master Plan, geophysical data and coastal community resilience information.

Use the Coastal Protection & Restoration Authority's online mapping tool to learn more about coastal flood risks to Louisiana communities now and in the future, as well as how to make your home, business and community safer and more resilient. Information includes future land change, storm surge flood risk, coastal vegetation and social vulnerability.
Apply to be paired with a free coach who will guide you from re-enrollment through graduation if you are a Louisianian with some college credit.

div.div: If you think your household could be affected by damages or lost wages due to a hurricane or other disaster, pre-register online or by phone for the Disaster Supplemental Assistance Program. DSNAP provides eligible low- to moderate-income householdsâ€”that do not normally receive SNAP benefitsâ€”with help buying groceries due to lost income or damages following a disaster.

FASTLANE Next Generation is the web-based system that manages Louisianaâ€™s business incentive programs that are approved by the Board of Commerce and Industry. FASTLANE is a secure online interface that allows applicants to electronically send data directly to Louisiana Economic Development. It is designed for individual applicants managing one company or consultants who manage multiple companiesâ€™ data.

Louisiana Economic Development's FastStart is a state workforce training program providing customized employee recruitment, screening, training development and training delivery for eligible, new or expanding companiesâ€”all at no cost.

File a complaint if you have been denied your housing rights or believe you may have experienced housing discrimination.

The Secretary of State's one-stop site for launching new businesses in Louisiana, providing current and potential business owners all the necessary information to operate in Louisiana.

GeauxPass is Louisiana's statewide toll system provided by the Department of Transportation and Development! With GeauxPass you can drive on Louisiana toll roads and enjoy nonstop driving without stopping to pay tolls.
Find your voting location, view a sample ballot and view election dates and results at the Secretary of State's clearinghouse for elections-related information.

Louisiana Economic Developmentâ€™s Job Connection recruitment website matches potential job seekers with Louisiana employment opportunities throughout the state. This website provides an in-depth, skills-based job matching platform to match job seekers with the jobs for which they are most qualified.

Search for faculty and staff job openings within the Louisiana State University System. The LSU System includes LSU A&M in Baton Rouge, LSU-Alexandria, LSU-Eunice, LSU-Shreveport, Pennington Biomedical Research Center, LSU Ag Center and more.
Search for faculty and staff job openings within the Southern University System, including SU-Baton Rouge, SU-New Orleans, SU-Shreveport and more.

Search for faculty and staff job openings at the nine campuses under the University of Louisiana System: UL-Lafayette, UL-Monroe, Nicholls State University, Southeastern Louisiana University, McNeese State University, Grambling State University, Northwestern State University, Louisiana Tech and The University of New Orleans.

Louisiana Checkbook is the state government's transparency and accountability portal. The one-stop website allows searching by spending type, agency and financial year, and provides interactive charts and graphs, downloadable data and the ability to compare across multiple categories.

The Louisiana Department of Natural Resourcesâ€™ SONRIS (Strategic Online Natural Resources Information System) tool provides data access (e.g., oil and gas information, coastal information), document access (e.g., Office of Conservation oil/gas production cards and field orders, Office of Mineral Resources lease records), GIS access (e.g., interactive mapping) and more.

Tow/Storage facillites can request permission to dispose of a junk vehicle using this tool from the Office of Motor Vehicles.
Review and sign up for training opportunities offered by the State Fire Marshal's Office
Online bidding can be submitted by businesses to the Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development through Bid Express.

Start or re-open an unemployment claim online as well as file for weekly benefits through the Louisiana Workforce Commission. Individuals are also provided assistance finding a job, creating a resume and finding training opportunities.

h4.a: Utility Purchase Gas Adjustments or Fuel Adjustments

div.div: Search for adjustments made to gas or fuel utility prices within the Public Service Commission's database.
Renew your Louisiana vehicle registration online through the Office of Motor Vehicles.

Cancel the liability insurance on a vehicle that you own and will not be using on any roads or highways. Your vehicle record will immediately be updated to indicate that the vehicle will not be used on the date range indicated.

Veterans Affairs operates four Veterans Cemeteries located across the state, offering a variety of burial options for veterans, spouses and dependent children. Complete the online Internment Application for consideration.
Apply online for nursing home care through Louisianaâ€™s five state-of-the-art Veterans Homes across the state.
Find Veterinarians and Veterinarian Technicians licensed through the Board of Veterinary Medicine.
Find Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors licensed through the Professional Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors Board of Examiners.
Renew payment for weights and measures with the Department of Agriculture & Forestry.
Online payment portal to pay workersâ€™ compensation assessment fees through the Louisiana Workforce Commission.
Submit an online request for Workers' Compensation records.

511 is Louisiana's official, easy-to-remember traveler information service. 511 provides continual updates about weather-related road conditions, road work, commercial vehicle restrictions, road closures, live video feeds from traffic cameras and other travel information.
